metadata.titleEn: Whole rock and single mineral geochemical data of Donggushan biotite granite in central Anhui Province
metadata.description: The data are the whole rock major, trace element and Pb isotopic geochemical data of donggushan biotite granite in central Anhui Province, as well as in-situ Hf isotopic data of zircon, major, trace element and Sr isotopic data of scheelite and S isotopic data of pyrite. The samples are from donggushan biotite granite in central Anhui Province. The major element data were obtained by XRF analysis, the trace element data were obtained by ICP-MS analysis, and the Pb isotopic composition data were obtained by ICP-MS analysis. Zircon U-Pb dating and in situ Lu Hf isotopic composition data were obtained by la-mc-icp-ms analysis. The major elements of scheelite were obtained by jxa8230 electron microprobe analysis, the trace elements by LA-ICP-MS analysis, and the in-situ Sr isotope of scheelite by MC-ICP-MS analysis. S isotope of pyrite was obtained by MC-ICP-MS analysis. The above data have been published in high-level SCI journals, and the data are true and reliable. The obtained data can be used to study the source, evolution and metallogenic process of donggushan tungsten deposit.
metadata.instructions: The geochemical data are stored in Excel format, and the sample name is "YY DD", where YY is the sampling year and DD is the sample ordinal number

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of data collection methods used for geochemical analysis of granitoid rocks?
Example.Answer: An example of data collection methods used for geochemical analysis of granitoid rocks includes the use of XRF for whole-rock major element analysis, ICP-MS for trace element and Pb isotope composition, and LA-MC-ICP-MS for zircon U-Pb dating and in-situ Lu-Hf isotope composition.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific characteristics and analytical methods used to measure the geochemical properties of biotite granite in the context of mineralization processes?
Feature Specification.Answer: whole-rock major element data, trace element data, Pb isotopic compositions, zircon U-Pb dating, in-situ Lu-Hf isotopic compositions, major elements in scheelite, trace elements in scheelite, in-situ Sr isotopes, pyrite S isotopes

Quantification.Question: How many types of isotopic data are obtained from the rock samples in a dataset related to Anhui Central Donggushan biotite granite?

Definition.Question: What are the data collection methods used to analyze the geochemical composition of biotite granite in the context of mineralization studies?
Definition.Answer: The data collection methods include XRF analysis for whole-rock major elements, ICP-MS for trace elements and Pb isotopic composition, LA-MC-ICP-MS for zircon U-Pb dating and in-situ Lu-Hf isotopic composition, JXA8230 electron probe for wolframite major elements, LA-ICP-MS for wolframite trace elements, MC-ICP-MS for in-situ Sr isotopic composition in wolframite, and MC-ICP-MS for S isotopic composition in pyrite.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the goals of collecting and analyzing geochemical data of whole rock, minerals, and isotopes from biotite granite in central Anhui?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The goal of collecting and analyzing geochemical data of whole rock, minerals, and isotopes from biotite granite in central Anhui is to study the source, evolution, and metallogenic processes of the Donggushan tungsten ore-forming fluids. This data aids in understanding the geochemical characteristics and isotopic compositions that inform the formation and development of mineral deposits in this region.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the instrumental and procedural considerations for obtaining comprehensive geochemical and isotopic data from biotite granite formations?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: Comprehensive geochemical and isotopic data from biotite granite formations can be obtained using several instrumental and procedural techniques. Major element data for whole rock samples are typically acquired through X-ray fluorescence (XRF) analysis. Trace element and Pb isotopic compositions are determined using Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (ICP-MS). Zircon U-Pb dating and in-situ Lu-Hf isotopic compositions are analyzed using Laser Ablation Multi-Collector ICP-MS (LA-MC-ICP-MS). For wolframite, major element analysis is conducted using an electron microprobe (JXA8230), trace elements are measured by LA-ICP-MS, and in-situ Sr isotopic data is acquired using MC-ICP-MS. Pyrite S isotopic data is also obtained using MC-ICP-MS. These methods allow for the investigation of the source, evolution, and mineralization processes of the ore-forming fluids in such formations.
